parse.title: List of Irish military casualties overseas

text.*:
A Ceremonial Guard at the site of the National Memorial to members of the Defence Forces who died in the Service of the State, Merrion Square, Dublin

This is a list of Irish military personnel of the Defence Forces who have died while serving overseas.

The list includes 86 names: 85 from the Irish Army and one from the Air Corps.

Since 1960, primarily as part of United Nations peacekeeping missions, 26 lives have been lost in the Congo under ONUC; 9 in Cyprus under UNFICYP; two in the Middle East under UNTSO; 46 in Lebanon under UNIFIL; one in East Timor under UNTAET; one in Liberia under UNMIL and one in Europe under the EU Nordic Battlegroup.

Contents

  • 1 Irish Defence Forces Roll of Honour
  • 2 Fatalities by mission
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Fatalities by mission[edit]

An MP stands on duty below the national flag at the monument
Mission Date of Deaths No. of Deaths
ONUC (mission ended) 1960–1963 26
UNFICYP (involvement ended) 1965–1971 9
UNTSO (ongoing) 1967–1982 2
UNIFIL (ongoing) 1978–2000 46
UNTAET (mission ended) 2002 1
UNMIL (mission ended) 2003 2
EU Nordic Battlegroup (ongoing) 2007 1
